com.mapbox.mapboxsdk

Class Mapbox

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.Mapbox

  • @UiThread
public final class Mapbox
extends java.lang.Object
    The entry point to initialize the Mapbox Android SDK.

    Obtain a reference by calling getInstance(Context, String). Usually this class is configured in Application#onCreate() and is responsible for the active access token, application context, and connectivity state.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        @UiThread
 @NonNull
public static Mapbox getInstance(@NonNull
                                                     android.content.Context context,
                                                     @Nullable
                                                     java.lang.String accessToken)
        Get an instance of Mapbox.

        This class manages the Mapbox access token, application context, and connectivity state.

        Parameters:
        context - Android context which holds or is an application context
        accessToken - Mapbox access token
        Returns:
        the single instance of Mapbox

      • getAccessToken

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String getAccessToken()
        Get the current active access token for this application.
        Returns:
        Mapbox access token

      • setAccessToken

        public static void setAccessToken(java.lang.String accessToken)
        Set the current active accessToken.

      • getSkuToken

        public static java.lang.String getSkuToken()
        Returns a SKU token, refreshed if necessary. This method is meant for internal SDK usage only.
        Returns:
        the SKU token

      • getApplicationContext

        @NonNull
public static android.content.Context getApplicationContext()
        Application context
        Returns:
        the application context

      • setConnected

        public static void setConnected(java.lang.Boolean connected)
        Manually sets the connectivity state of the app. This is useful for apps which control their own connectivity state and want to bypass any checks to the ConnectivityManager.
        Parameters:
        connected - flag to determine the connectivity state, true for connected, false for disconnected, and null for ConnectivityManager to determine.

      • isConnected

        public static java.lang.Boolean isConnected()
        Determines whether we have an internet connection available. Please do not rely on this method in your apps. This method is used internally by the SDK.
        Returns:
        true if there is an internet connection, false otherwise

      • getTelemetry

        @Nullable
public static TelemetryDefinition getTelemetry()
        Get an instance of Telemetry if initialised
        Returns:
        instance of telemetry

      • getModuleProvider

        @NonNull
public static ModuleProvider getModuleProvider()
        Get the module provider
        Returns:
        moduleProvider

      • hasInstance

        public static boolean hasInstance()
        Internal use. Check if the INSTANCE is present.
